Participants.evidence: adult patients with postamputation pain of 6 months or longer and greater than 3 on a 0–10 numeric pain rating scale

Intervention.evidence: Each of the three treatment periods (morphine, mexiletine, or placebo)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome measure was change in average pain intensity from the drug-free baseline to the last week of maintenance.

Number_Analysed.evidence: data were analyzed from 56 subjects for one drug period, 45 subjects for two drug periods, and 35 subjects who completed all three drug periods

Result_Outcome.evidence: Morphine treatment provided lower pain scores compared with placebo and mexiletine ( P = 0.0003). The mean percent pain relief during treatment with placebo, mexiletine, and morphine was 19, 30, and 53%, respectively ( P < 0.0001, morphine vs. placebo and mexiletine).

Harms.evidence: Treatment with morphine was associated with a higher rate of side effects.
